definition: to fill a vacancy/to make up for a shortage/to supply a deficiency
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to remedy omissions and correct errors (idiom)
see 拾遺補缺|拾遗补缺[shi2 yi2 bu3 que1]

sentences.english: Vacancies in the House of Representatives are filled only by a special election or in a general election.
sentences.chinese: 众议员补缺要通过专门选举或随大选进行。

sentences.english: The research on idioms of a book is important to the ancient books.
sentences.chinese: 专书成语研究对古籍的今注今译有着纠谬补缺的作用。

sentences.english: We go to by- elections, and work a - gainst the Government.
sentences.chinese: 我们去参加补缺选举，反对政府。

sentences.english: This book is not complete yet, there is still much to be added.
sentences.chinese: 完善，还有需要拾遗补缺的地方。

sentences.english: A hiring manager may fill a vacancy but cannot hire a relative.
sentences.chinese: 雇佣经理可以补缺，但不能雇佣亲戚。

definition: to remedy omissions and correct errors (idiom)
to fall vacant/a job opening at a high level
to fill a gap/to fill in a blank (on a form)/to overcome a deficiency
second (i.e. number two)/second time/twice/(math.) quadratic (of degree two)
to cover up mistakes or crimes/to stitch up/to fix
to bring up to full strength/to make up a deficiency/to fill (a vacancy, gap etc)
